reviews.review_msg: Such an amazing and inspiring prof. Could literally go to her for anything. Her classes were fun and I enjoyed the class

I highly recommend this professor for CMNS 316, she made the lectures extremely interesting and easy to follow. There is only one group assignment that you are graded on, but the TA and professor are both super accessible if you need help.

Overall, he's a great prof. The lectures were long and sometimes he goes off topic but he's very good at explaining course concepts in an engaging way. I will say his slides could be improved (sometimes he will just put a quote from a reading and not explain the confusing terminology). He's approachable outside of class and quite understanding.
Darren was a knowledgeable and sweet prof. I learned a lot from this course and am very appreciative of the effort he puts in his lectures.

I enjoyed Darren's course. He's enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the content he teaches. His readings benefit from being read thoroughly. He records audio of the lectures and posts them after class since the slides don't include all of the info he talks about. I would give him a 5/5, but I never received my final paper marks back.
Very tough course with heavy lectures and reading. Midterm & final were in person with very high expectations! TA WAS horrible at grading.
Lectures were so heavy, writing Midterms & finals in person. TA was tough in grading.

Darren is a good prof, took him for CMNS 110 before and got a pretty good grade. However, I would not take a high level course with him because you will need to sweat to get a good grade. You need a good TA as well and not the ones who speak worse English than you. Group projects certainly didn't help. Word of advice - find online alternatives

Honestly, I am surprised by these reviews...I had her for 316 and I thought she was such a fun prof! The lectures were always engaging and fun. She was nice to talk to if you had questions. Only downside is she is not the best lecturer, she knows her stuff but doesn't land her point as well as she could. Would def take again!
This class was interesting but the final project was work 50% of your grade which sucked. Also, the grading rubric and assignment instructions were quite vague.

He is a veteran of his industry. He is very passionate about certain issues and is very knowledgeable about the theory behind news and broadcasting. He also explains well, is reasonably balanced during discussions about controversial topics in class

In order to do well in papers, just quote+cite and format a bunch of journals that prove your point

I'm pretty sure this was the best class I ever took at SFU. Most of the times we want classes to be easy in order to consider them a great class but this class was challenging in a good way. I learned quite a lot and got out of my bubble and spoke in lectures. This is because he was super engaging and insightful.

Al-Rawi is honestly one of the best teachers I've had at SFU. If you are ever considering taking CMNS316 with him I'd highly encourage it. I am usually a pretty shy person, and his lectures often require student participation in the form of class discussion, but he makes it a really comfortable learning environment where anyone can speak up.
